greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: For g=A201557(n), define a(n) by prime p|g such that G(g/p) is maximum, where G(k) = sigma(k)/(k*log(log(k))).
comment: The ratio G(A201557(n)/p)/G(A201557(n)) is defined by Nicolas as the Gronwall quotient (A201557 = proper GA1 numbers).
link: Michel Marcus, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
G. Caveney, J.-L. Nicolas and J. Sondow, On SA, CA, and GA numbers, Ramanujan J., 29 (2012), 359-384.
J.-L. Nicolas, Table of proper GA1 numbers up to 10^60, 2011.
program: (PARI) findq(i) = {f = factor(i); maxqu = 0.0; qmax = 0; for(iq=1, length(f~), qq = f[iq,1]; qu = g(i/qq)/g(i); if (qu > maxqu, maxqu = qu; qmax = qq;) ); return (qmax);} \\ for i in A201557
results.author: _Michel Marcus_, Sep 10 2012
ext: Definition simplified and formula supplied by _Jonathan Sondow_, Sep 11 2012
